intro: Cnidium silaus, commonly known as silversword, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its rosette of silver-gray leaves. The plant produces a tall, branched stem that bears small, yellowish flowers. It thrives in high-elevation environments and is adapted to the unique climate of Hawaii. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
